content.description:
Sit start in the very back of the cave with a right hand hidden under-cling and left on top of the jug. Pull on and make a right hand move out to a 3 finger packet in the crack. From here move left hand out to a good but slightly slopey flake. Then encounter the crux. move to the lip using cool foot beta, once hit the lip make two moves up to a jug and drop off. 

  The first two moves will feel like the crux if you do not get the beta right think kneebar :) 

  The problem could not be topped out due to snow and ice but will be able to top out once the snow is gone and when that happens it will probably get another star and may be a bump up in grade. 

  There is a really hard looking variation that would come in from the left on a long horizontal roof and meet with this problem at the lip. Looks like it will be at least V8 any takers?
content.protection: Pads for uneven landing and spotter.
content.location: On the left side of the Middle Boulder clamber in between two coffee table size boulders to the little roof.

content.description:
The crux is the first move. Using a side-pull crimp with your left and and a good hold with your right, pick some feet out left and toss up and right to a sharp slopey hold. Picking the correct feet for the start will keep it at the grade. Hit the slopey jug and work your feet to the right and make use of a good heel-hook. Then move up and left to a series of really cool jugs to another hard move up to the final jug and drop off.  

  There is a harder start starting all the way in the back but I couldnt make the first move and the start I did seems more like the natural line, so i just left it like this. 

  This couldn't be topped out due to ice and snow but once it is melted and I give it a good cleaning, it may get another start.
content.location: The route is the right most route on the middle boulder start off the obvious right hand hold and your pick of two small side-pull crimps with your left hand.

content.description: A low ball with a lot of steep problems. The left most side has a short roof that is home to Wallace's Roof (v2+) and then the main section of the boulder has an overhung face that leads to a vertical wall to the top. The rock is sharp but climbable.
